description: This course reviews theories and methods in anthropology that guide the study of businesses or corporations, a major socioeconomic institution of the modern world. How do we look at various workplace activities, aspects, and events, and what can we look for to begin addressing our questions? During the first half of the course, we review major theories and discuss their significances or contributions to understanding different parts of business organizational life. In the latter half, we examine several cultural and linguistic anthropological methods udes to conduct researches in business settings, and discuss its relation to theories.
name: ANTHROPOLOGY OF BUSINESS
